Universally for the sake of Brahma, Indra, the Four Heavenly Kings, the eight classes of spiritual beings, the emperor, the people, teachers, monks, parents, and good and virtuous friends, as well as the assembly of the Dharma realm, all aspire to eliminate all hindrances and take refuge in repentance.
Repenting with utmost sincerity!

The disciples, from the vast kalpas of beginningless time until today, have been deluded about self-realization, considering there to be a self and a person. Once the self is established, it always revolves around the self. The sense faculties and objects whirl around, and the consciousness skandha rushes like waves. It strikes the body and mind, like lightning flashing. The pure eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, in a single moment of non-realization, turn into the six teachers, stealing the Dharma king's wealth to supply the thieves of extreme views.
Once the thieves become rampant, they destroy the city of nirvana, harm the dharma body, and burn the wisdom life.
Such offenses are as numerous as dust motes, from delusion to delusion, with no end in sight.

Only now do I awaken and deeply regret and shame myself. Day and night I am frightened, my body and mind trembling. Forever ending delusion and awakening, greed and love for self and others, I take refuge in the city of nirvana and return to the country of peace and bliss.

With the realization of no-self, I subdue the six masters, gather the wealth of the Dharma King, and store it in the three firm treasuries. I provide for the life of wisdom and increase the Dharma body. I light the lamp of the nature of dharmas, always illuminating without end. Practice, vows, principle and phenomena, the dusts and realms are not in opposition. The Three Jewels and the Three Vehicles I vow to uphold and protect. The offenses of delusion and awakening I repent and extinguish.
Having repented and dedicated, I take refuge in the Three Jewels with utmost sincerity.
With utmost sincerity I make this vow!

The disciples and sentient beings in the Dharma realm, from this day forth until attaining supreme enlightenment, moment by moment firm, moment by moment advancing, with mastery of body and mind, unobstructed eloquence, in a single thought replete with all knowledge, should know that all dharmas are ultimately empty and quiescent, yet always liberating all sentient beings, together realizing nirvana, not taking nirvana as a realization.
Having made this vow, with utmost sincerity take refuge and pay homage to the Three Jewels.
